item.title: History and Narratives
item.description: Frequently historians present themselves as objective observers just using evidence to presen the history. However to me it appears that many have some framework and narrative in mind and then choose evidence to fit the story they want to tell.

item.title: Trautmann: Aryans and British India
item.description:
Trautmann came across a stone inscription in Sanskrit near the entryway of the Old Indian Institute Building at Oxford. From viewing this, the special character of British concept of Aryan came to him as an epiphany. (page 3)

Aryans and British India, Thomas R. Trautmann, ISBN 0-520-20546-4, Call number DS425.T68 1997, University of California Press.
